text: Bouteille achetée chez Amstein - De couleur noir avec une petite mousse fauve crémeuse qui tient longtemps - Au nez des arômes de de fumée, de cendre, de malt torréfié, café, chocolat, terreux - En bouche encore plus de fumé et de cendre, le café et le chocolat sont bien équilibré, cest très terreux, une bonne texture et légèrement sucrée - Corp moyen/full, amertume moyenne, carbonation légère, douce et onctueuse, final amère fumée douce et terreuse - je trouve le fumé trop lourd et ca laisse une amertume moyennement agréable, le reste est juste parfait

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2017 Bottle. Color: Almost black, nutbrown head. Taste: Earthy, dark roasted malt, smoke, dark coffee, bitter but also sweet notes. Dry mouthfeel. Soft carbonation, above medium body. Overall a pretty mild, very enjoyable smoked porter.

Aromas ahumados y a bodega
Buen aspecto mala retencion de espuma
En boca compleja, ahumados, torrefactos y cafe.
Muy bebible sin ser pesada
Pitch black colour with small beige head.Aroma is mild smoked with flavor of coffee and caramel,nice smoked mouthfeels and also chocolate nots,really nice and mild overall.
Fra flaske på Mi2 Cardinal mai-17: brunsvart med flitt beige skum. Røykmalt, visne solbær, kreosot, grunnsmøring. Kaffe og mørk sjokolade blander seg etterhvert inn i smaksbildet.
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 08.05.17. Dark brown to ebony. Aroma of dark malt and smoke. Similar taste, with dark chocolate. Still good drinkability

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2017 Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy dark brown with little beige head. Aroma of smoke, chocolate. Tastes bitter with some sweetness ane umami. Medium bodied, bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 330 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 6.3%, IBU 43. Very dark brown / nearly black colour, small beige head. Strong aroma of roast malts and smoked malts, notes of coffee, chocolate and bonfire. The flavour is fortunately not too dry (but not sweet either), slightly fruity, again with dominant notes of roast malts and smoked malts, also notes of coffee and dark bitter chocolate.

Bottle shared by Thompson. Looks dark brown, almost black, and opaque with a very small beige head. Smell gives roasted coffee, smoked bacon and a slight hint of sweetness at the end. Taste brings lots of herbs, hops and some roasted malts. Is not as bitter as the smell would suggest. Overall, a very enjoyable beer that is suited for both colder and darker times as well as the beginning of spring.

bottle @ home... shared with Bobson. Poured a almost none existent brown/beige head. Very dark brown to black colour with brown edges. Smell of roasted coffee, smoke, salty smoked ham/bacon.. taste hops some bitter herbs smoked lacks the coffee thats in the smell though. Its quite subtle on the bitterness. A nice balanced beer.

Bottle. Pours a crystal clear dark brown, dark reddish beer with a big beige head on top. Aroma has lots of smoke and roasted malts going on, some chocolate and a vague hint of caramel in the back. Flavor is roasty sweetness with smoke, like drinking a freshly barbecued cut of meat. Was hoping for a bit more balance in there with the chocolate going on, but there isnt much going. Mostly roast and smoke, which is still a good thing considering that Im drinking a smoked porter. Oh well.. I can go on with this forever,no point in that. Just a nice and well made beer, lets keep it at that.

Ca doit être mon amour pour les whiskys fumés et tourbés, ainsi que mon amour pour le bacon. Bon le bacon sans plus en fait, mais quand on ressent lalchimie, viande fumée dans un breuvage, ou plutôt fumée au bacon, ça fais plaisir. Tout y est agréable, la vue, les bulles, la mousse. De lodeur, du goût, de la belle finale. jen veux encore ! Pour les amateurs de choses fumées.
Aroma of salty smoked ham.Taste starts with salty smoked ham,te ashtray liqourice, hint of cofee and cocoa.very nice smoked porter.

Appearance: dark brown, slight tan head
Aroma: deep smoky bacon aroma
Palate: medium full, low carbonation
Taste: smoke and big bacon flavours. Bitterness kicks in on after taste
Overall: great beer
Couleur brun foncé; mousse beige; arômes et goût maltés, chocolatés et de fumée; finale moyennement amère

I bought this bottle at beerlovers shop in Vienna, wonderful city. I drank it yesterday with my wife, after to came back from Geneva. In my point of view, it is a delicious porter, I think that it sounds more a stout with the taste. As usual, the body is a beautiful and deep black color, white and brown foam, regular carbonation for the style. At the mouth, when you drink it, the first impression is good:roasted malt, coffee, a side smocked but not so strong and it is a kind of dry wood that you burn, little side of vanilla, cacao, well balanced and interesting for the style.

Zwart met een beetje donkerrood onderin, lichtbruine schuimkraag die snel zakt.
Aroma: Geroosterde mouten, gerookte ham, iets wrang, chocolade. 
Smaak: Donkere geroosterde mouten , iets minder rokerig dan het aroma, hout, kruidig, redelijk zoet en grassige hop tonen met een goede bitter. In de nasmaak veel chocolade en geroosterde hinten. Gelukkig is de peat niet overdreven. 
Medium body, zacht en romig mondgevoel , afdronk is rokerig en bitterzoet. 
Erg goed!

Bottiglia di un un anno e mezzo. Color ebano scuro con riflessi rubini, schiuma color nocciola, molto fine, non abbondante e dalla lunga persistenza. Al naso inizialmente sprigiona note di sansa, salamoia, ma riscaldandosi svela note torbate e di castagne del prete (affumicate, dunque). Al palato ancora note tostate di castagna affumicata, con un leggero etilico e amaro finale. Corpo medio, carbonazione quasi assente. Sensazione vellutata al palato, con una buona secchezza finale.

Nougat-colored foam. Discreet smoky aroma. Thick, oily mouthfeel with strong smoked flavor and hard roasted malt. Light chocolate complements its a bit heavy smoke flavor excellent. The carbonation is soft and hop bitterness is balanced fine. It is as a whole well combined and well-brewed stout belonging in the heavy end of stouts. Elegant, albeit somewhat one-sided on the smoked side.
Pours black, just a few bubbles of head, not even a full ring. Aroma is wood smoke and coffee grounds. Body is toward the watery end of medium, though still silky. Drinks like liquid smoke, nearly.

Thick dark brown with no head, and a lovely aroma with just the right hint of smoke. Smooth porter flavor enhanced by a bit of milk chocolate with an underlayer of smoke that lingers long after everything else goes. Medium bodied. Extremely nice.
Ampolla. Cervesa fosca i fumada amb aromes de brioix molt fet i salmó fumat suau. Molt bona!

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2017 Belle robe noire. mousse honnête.
nez fumé très agréable.
légère. gout un peu passe-partout. On ne retrouve pas trop le fumé en bouche

bonus décorum : un être innommable tout droit sorti dun innsmouth lovecraftien :5/5
0,33l bottle. Dark brown color with small beige head. Aroma of carael and smoked ham. Sweet-bitter taste of smoked roasted malt, smoked ham and some liquor. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Sample at Borefts 2016. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is roasty smoked malt liqourice. The flavour is moderate liqouice bitter with a dry ashtray liqourice, coffee light hop palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

On tap at Craft Beer Corner. Dark brown to black with a beige head. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty and quite smoky aroma of caramel, chocolate and smoked ham. Rather sweet, malty, slightly roasty and quite smoky taste of milk chocolate, some coffee, a touch of licorice and quite a bit of smoked ham, followed by a medium long, slightly roasty-bitter, quite smoky finish. Over medium-bodied, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Tasty!

Color negro con capa de espuma marrón (compacta, burbujas gruesas, buena retención). Carbonatación mínima. Aroma a café, chocolate y ahumado bastante presente. Riquísimo. Sabor a chocolate, café, caramelo, con final herbal y ligeramente amargo. El ahumado está poco presente en boca, para mi gusto. Muy rica. Esperaba algo distinto, todo hay que decirlo.

Aug. 16. A 0.33 l bottle at Craft Room, Zagreb. It poured a pitch black body with medium to big brown head. Aroma of smoked cheese, caramel, coffee, cocoa with some light but fine herbal hops. Flavor was lightly sweet, caramel dominated with a subtle smoked note. Medium bodied with a long finish, where smoked peaty character was more pronounced together with light coffee, caramel and more complex toasted malts like dried fruits, wood and light herbal bitterness. A nice smoked porter, gets better later, maybe was served a bit too cold initially.
Deep, dark brown with a small mocha head. Aroma is smoke, wet soil. Strong espresso taste with charred marshmallows, caramel, and a bit of milk.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

43 IBU zwart bier met weinig beige schuim. Geur: geroosterde mout, licht gerookt, sojasaus, licht zoet, wat rubber. Smaak: koffie, ristretto, groen bitter, licht gerookt, licht zoutig, oxo, drop. Sprankelende koolzuurprikkel. Redelijk lichte body. Afdronk: licht zoetig, koffie, wat bitter. Complex en levendig bier!

20. 11. 2016, Ljubljana. Bottled. Nice subtle smoky feel, present aroma, medium body, light headed. Short lasting aftertaste, just enough.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sampel at Borefts 2016. Black beer, Aroma is smoke, fruit. Taste is the same with some sweetness, nice

Jawohl, Rauchfahnen bestimmen den Charakter des gesamten Bieres. In der Nase eher dezent und mit einem leichten Dunkelbeereneinschlag versehen, kommt die Smokeyness beim trinken so richtig in Fahrt. Eingebettet in ein gleitend angesüßtes Mundgefühl, bleiben gerade zum Ausklang hin, viele Rauchbierverweise hängen. Allerdings ist das Spektrum nicht gerade als Komplex zu bezeichnen, klar ein bisschen Hopfenbittere hier und Röstflavours da, aber immer alles schön sachte. Hiermit können Anfänger an das Genre SMOKED herangeführt werden 🙂. 0,33/3 Flasche aus HH. BEYOND BEER. Na ja, und eigentlich ist es ja auch ein Porter und zwar ein sehr gelungen verrauchtes. Hab gestern ein mit Polaris verhopftes von SANDER getrunken...welch Unterschied. I LOVE BEER...

Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, liquorice, roasted malts and smoke.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit and liquorice; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and smoke.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. The aroma could have been stronger and the taste would have benefited from more chocolate flavours. Amazing appearance and a great palate, both being the saviours of this beer.

Draft @ Pivo & Burger Fest Oct16, Ljubljana.
Brune foncée, col crémeux blanc-cassé voire café au lait.
Arôme malt grillé, caramel fume perce en rétro-nasal. Il reste léger mais parfat pour le style, petite pointe de citrornné houblonné en rétro, noble Slovène? Petite pointe de fruité noir rappelant les raisins.
Palais au acarctère bien malté le tout gardant de bons éléments de fumé avec une balance houblonné qui offre une petite pointe damertume noble. Le fumé perdure sur la fin sans être surfait. Après eur Smoked Pils, encore une belle réussite niveau des malts fumés.
At BBF, pitch black color, aroma of coal and smoked meat, smokey meaty flavor with lots of chocolate, a bit of sweetness, but almost completley dry. Very good.
Brown black, beige head, slightly smoked aroma, chocolate, coffee, fun, smoked flavor, burnt wood, chocolate, coffee, fun, medium bodied.

Handpumped at MastroBirrario, Trieste. 
Roasted, burned, dark caramel aroma.
Black, fantastic layered creamy brown cream
Medium light, dry mellow body.
Dry roast, smoke, dark grain, good hop profile. Very drinkable, nice!

On tap at Borefts, shared.
thin ring tan head. Clear black pour. Nice smokey aftertaste

Bottle 33cl, a dark beer with medium creamy head. Nose is intense on smoked malt and chocolate. Aroma is on chocolate, toasted caramel, grassy hops, quite smoked, mainly dry body, medium creamy. Finish is on leather, peated notes, some vegetable, still dry with hay touch, good balance.
Bottle from a trade. Many thanks! Black colour, brown foam. Roasty, dry and hoppy bitter, light smoke character. Solid porter.

Draft at Borefts 2016, Day 2. Dark brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of roast, malt, overripe dark fruits and caramel. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. [24-09-2016]

Bue à la pression en 10cl au Borefts de De Molen à Bodegraven
Couleur noire, mousse marron peu deffervescence
Nez sur le café
en bouche attaque sur le chocolat et le café avec une pointe fumé et tourbé bel équilibre final avec le sucre.

Draught @ Borefts16: Served in a taster:
Almost black body, brown head.
Nose of smoke, roast, bacon, tobacco...
Flavours of roast, smoke, bitter, malts, honey, tobacco...
Aftertaste is bitter, toast, rye...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: UPDATED: SEP 24, 2016 On tap at Borefts. Near black with a lasting off-white head. Roasted aroma with licorice and a touch of smoke. Sweet fruity and roasted flavour with ash, smoke and a touch of resin
Tap at Borefts. Almost black with beige head. Light smoke, chalk, earthy, old coffee dregs, soft herbs, dusty cocoa. Almost medium bitter and light sweet. Medium bodied with dry feel.

Sampled from tap at Borefts 2016 day 1. Dark brown. With creme head. Chocolate and smoked malt. Tea leaves. Medium sweet and bitter. Over medium body, soft mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Sweet smokey toffee finish.
Bruin bier met een goede beige schuim kraag. Ruikt geroosterd, zoet, kruidig. Smaakt kruidig, geroosterd, mout.

Bottle in trade with Sebilinz cons 2016-07-26
AR: peaty whiskey, chocokate, tar, asphalt
AP: dark ruby/blackish, frothy steady sand brown head
F: peaty, black ham, sauna, milk chocolate, tar, dry, salt liqurice

BBE 23.07.2016. Musta väri, iso tuuhea stouttimainen vaahto, viipyy. Tuoksu miellyttävän savuinen, lämmettyään myös pepsiä. Suutuntuma vetisehkön stouttimainen, savuisa, mukavasti bodyä, samettisen kuohuva, alkoholi ei oikeastaan näy kuin pikkuisen. Muikea smoked.
bottle. Dark black with smaller tan head. Aroma is smoked, dark roasted coffee, licorice. Taste of espresso, roasted malt, sea weed, well balanced. Full bodied, dry, good hoppy finish. Excellent

Shortlived darker beige head over ruby-shot black beer. Rich dark malty nose, some smoke, smoked ham, black cardamome peel, hint @ fusels, phenols, Lapsan Souchong, Islay malt. Sharp-ish and smoked taste, ashes, phenols but also caramel, dark candi sugar, molasses and toffee, though certinaly not really sweet. Roast, and even a bit of stout acidity. Despite only 6.3%, a rich, velvety, luxurious feel; good carbonation. Pretty impressive.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2016 Bottle. Clear dark brown colour with a relatively small tan head, nose is smoke and bacon with some hints of blue cheese, caramel and herbs, taste is a little sweet and very smoky with a dry finish, carbonation is a bit weak, mouthfeel a little watery.

Thank you Mathieu87 & PriorL! 330 ml. bottle sampled @ Epic beer Tasting 2016. Black, mocha bubbles. Nose is rather metallic with very heavy roast. Taste is bitter roast, herbal, smoke is rather vegetable, leaves, bitter hop. Syrupy & heavily roasted body. Okay but not really all that for me, in general I dont get the very high ratings that this brewery gets.

33cl bottle. Dark brown pour with a medium height tan head that gives way to a thick lacing. Roasted malts, light smoke, dark chocolate, lactose, sweet cherries and a hefty amount of brewed coffee. Medium body, low carbonation and a roasty bitter-sweet aftertaste.
Cerveza ahumada. Muy ligera y fresca. El tono ahumado es menos acentuado que en otras, lo que la hace más ligera, y quizás con algo menos de sabor.
On tap. Black with brown head. Toasted malts aroma with smokey hints, oak. Ash, coffee, chocolate, smokey flavour

33cl flesje via Het Bierhuis, Breda
Alcoholpercentage van 6,3%
Uitgeschonken in Leffe glas

Uiterlijk: zwart met kleine cremelaag

Aroma en smaak: gebrande mouten, gerookt, koffie, chocolade

Conclusie: lekkere gerookte porter

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Interesting and complex combination of flavours: roasted malt and coffee and something smoked, Id even say cheese or fat meat like pork.
Indeed the beer has an almost creamy texture on the tongue.

Fortunatly there is a slight bitter finish helping to clean the mouth, because the beer tends to be a little heavy as it get warmer.
33 cl. bittle. Dark brown to black colour with a small beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, smoke and chocolate.

In bottiglia. Colore nero impenetrabile. Schiuma color nocciola, soapy e cremosa, di ottima persistenza. Olfatto tostato di caffè e caramello amaro. Carbonazione flat. Aroma di orzo, latte, caffè, cioccolata, lieve caramello bruciato, legno, leggera torba, cenere e luppolo. Gusto leggermente dolce torbato, affumicato delicato, leggermente amaro con buona luppolatura nello stile, pure asciutta. Corpo appena più che leggero, trama lattica. Molto meno alcoolica del previsto, estremamente godibile e accessibile.

Bottled at Sir Williams, Ljubljana.  Black with creamy beige head. Smoky salami up front. Dry with medium body and clean, hard mouthfeel. Metallic and severely overcarbonated. The interesting tarry licorice smoke struggle to come out from the metallic fizz. Resiny metallic finish. Lacks the malt depth to carry the smoke, what I find is a resimy metallic edgy mess.

Look: black, opaque, strong beige head.

Aroma: fat smoked pork, smoked cheese.
Taste: light swetness, light to moderate hoppy and burned bitterness.
Flavour: rye bread with prunes, smoked mature cheese, umami.

Very good and very smoked.

Bottle. Pours dark brown color with medium-big brownish head. Aroma of mostly smoked malts with some coffee and roasty notes. Hops character is hidden because of smoky notes. Smoke notes are probably from rauchmalt not from peated malt as I expected. Flavor is also some kind of yeasty. Medium-full body. Balanced level of bitterness and sweetness. Overall: good beer. But that yeast character or something else (i dont know) is, for me, not going together with rauchmalts. Anyway. Good beer.

330 ml bottle. Pours dark black with an average light brown head. Aroma of heavy roasted malt and pronounced but not obtrusive smoke. Creamy medium to full body with a light sweet and bitter taste. Hints of bacon. Long lightly alcoholic and strong smoky finish.

Marrone sicurissimo, bella schiuma marroncino compatta e persistente. Aroma super di malto tostato, caffè, affumicata molto marcata. Benissimo anche la bevuta, un po secca e amara, affumicato intenso, caffè, cioccolato, consistenza un pelo oleosa. Carbonazione media. Veramente ottima.

Super swietny porter, bardzo smaczny treściwy i wytrawny. Mocno palony slod miesza się z gozka czekolada. Piekna bezowa piana spora ale średnio trwala, niemal czarne metniste piwo, bardzo geste. Aromat sliwki wedzonej i goracej czekolady, trochę ziaren kawowca. Na koniec mamy wyczuwalna goryczke i piękny wytrawno palony dlugi finisz.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 (33 cl bottle in wine glass.) Pours bronze brown with a finger thick brownish-yellow head. Aroma has a full smoke note yet not very intense. I just fills up the glass in a rather shy way. The mouthfeel is great, thick and smooth as oil. But the taste is thin! Watery even. Very surprising and a pity.
Bottle. Pours dark brown color with light brown head. Aroma of cigars, smoke, coffee, roasted malts and caramel. Medium bitterness. Dry and bitter aftertaste. Very good.
Poured reddish brown with a huge frothy tan head. Aroma of roast malt, dark fruit and dark chocolate. Medium body, quite smooth, flavour is dry rauched malt, chocolate, coffee.
Zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt gerookt, bbq, ziltig vanille. Smaakt koffie, bitter, gerookt, bbq.

bottle from @Saeglopur [European Local swap 1/2016], thanks
pitch black with a full fine brown head. aroma of chocolate, roasted malts, smoked ham, hops. taste has a weak sour note in it, smoked malts, smoked ham, chocolate, medium bitterness, roasted malts, cacao, oily, smooth, low co2, quite some body, however didnt like the sour notes .. despite ok
Bottle. A smoky porter indeed! Aroma of coffee and cocoa over slight warm smoke. Bitter and intense yet light and simple. Smooth and very nice to drink!

Tap @Luppolo12, Roma. Black with light tan head. Smoke and wet leather aroma. Smoky flavour with some burnt malt. Chocolate and coffee too. Easily drinkable, light yet very flacourful with a touch of hops in the finish. Nice.

Smoked, leather, bit of meat, very beautiful deep brown with a huge rocky brown head quite creamy, medium body law carbonation, taste of coffee, leather, smoked, not too bitter...i want to hug you misshapen monster.

Bottle at GH. Black with beige head. Aroma has coffee, smoke, woody notes, chocolate, herbs and roasted malt. Taste is heavy with smoke, toasted bread, chocolate, coffee, more smoke, wood and vanilla. Highly smoked and still pleasant.

Közepes, tartós hab, fekete szín. Füstös, pörkölt malátás illatvilág. Markánsan füstös, pörkölt malátás ízvilág, kissé száraz, kakaóbabos aromával. Utóíze nem túl élénk és nem is túl hosszú, pörkölt malátás, füstös. Közepesen testes, egy picit talán túl könnyed.
Drank with Kaspar 19-3-16 at my place. Very much taste for such a low ABV beer. Nice porter to start with. Pleasant in the mouth, good taste, a bit thick, fine.

33cl Bottle from Vonk. Black colour, beige - brown head. Aroma of leather, smoke, meat, roasted malts, fruits. Flavour is light to medium sweet, leather, light ashy, smoke, meat, chocolate, fruity, leathery bitter finish. Medium bodied. Great smoked porter.

Pours black with beige thick head. Nose can feel some coffee, raisins, dark chocolate, some herbs, roasted malt. Mouth is satisfied with smoke, crispy toasted dark bread, some chocolate, toffee, raisin, vanilla. Long mild smoky after with hops and cocoa. Good one!

Bottiglia 33 cl. Marrone scuro con bellissima schiuma persistente color nocciola. Note di malto tostato e affumicato, anche in bocca con sentori di caffè e corteccia. Corpo medio, carbonazione leggera.

How: Bottle.
Where: Bir & Fud Bottega, Rome.
Appearance: Dark brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Smoke, chocolate, roasted malt, dried fruit, some liquorice.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, chocolate, smoke, caramel, raisin, roasted malt, ash.
Very dark and very smoky. Ingeniosity and stupidity, zwei in einem: so typical for Austria. So many strong tastes in one botle. Hardly to forget. I like some medicine taste, also strong.

Kolor : Czarny, kompletnie nieprześwitujący. 
Piana : Piana w kolorze karmelowym o super-drobnej strukturze. Bardzo trwała, puszysta i dobrze krążkująca.
Piana do ostatniego łyka piwa pozostaje na szkle , a nawet jeszcze po wypiciu na jego dnie. 
Zapach : W pierwszych niuchach mocna paloność, potem lekko wędzony charakter.
Minimum czekolady i trochę kawy. 
Smak: Początkowo słodko-czekoladowy, który wkrótce zmienia się w bardziej wytrawny z charakterystyczną kawową kwaskowością.
Paloność i wędzone nuty trochę mniej widoczne.
Piwo jest ekstrymalnie gęste, jak czarna, ciekła smoła.
Goryczka wytrawna, krótka, średnio mocna. 
Wysycenie: Średnie. 
Podsumowanie: 

Austriacki Browar BeVog jest chyba moim pierwszym browarem craftowym z tego kraju.
Bardzo dobry start i pierwsze piwo z tego browaru, które trafiło do mojego szkła.
Okazało się to bardzo błogim doświadczeniem.
Co jest najważniejszym jego walorem?
Jego gęsta, smolista konsystencja i czekoladowo-kawowy charakter.

Kolejne piwa z tego browaru czekają w mojej lodówce na swoją kolejkę;-)
330 ml bottle. Black dark colour. Aroma of stout meat,yeasts. Taste of chocolate,yeast,light notes of citrus fruits. Good drinkable stout

Pours black with a big beige head. Malty and smokey with hints of smoked cheese, licorice, coffee and wet smoked wood. Medium bodied with nice bitter/sweet balance. On the palate it tastes of toasted malts, dark chocolate, coffe and some walnut liquor. Not so long-lasting with nice bitter/smoked/walnuty aftertaste.

Appearance: clear ruby dark brown with light beige head.
Aroma: smoked malt, some chocolate, some coffee.
Taste: smoked malt, some chocolate, bitter-sweet with some sour.
Palate: smooth, medium body, low carbonation.
Overall: very nice.

From XXXII. In Teku glass. Watching Sons of Anarchy 4x10. The smoke hides everything. Its not as disgusting as a rauchbier but cant enjoy it. At least I could finish this.
Bottle at home, 3rd January 16. Aroma is smoke, peat, chocolate. Taste is smoke, chocolate. Thin mouth feel. Not bad

(bottle) deep brown-black in colour with a creamy dark beige head. aroma of smoked ham, toasted malts and dark chocolate, with some notes of vanilla, brown sugar and smoked cheese. flavour is mostly the same, lots of toasted malts and dark chocolate, with much less smoke, a light touch of liquorice and a slightly tart finish. thin-bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottled 33 cl at a PDA event on January 2, 2016. 6.3% ABV, 43 IBU, BB 29.10.2016.Black color, small brown head. Sweet, malty, smoked, slight lactic scent. Smoked, malty, mineral taste. Grainy aftertaste. Some alcohol. Medium to sort of thin mouthfeel, low bitterness.
Dark brown with a tiny brown head. Malty and smokey. Malt, smoke, fruit and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter / roasted finish.

Bottle at home. Aroma is light roasted malt, flawlessly balanced smoke, dark chocolate, hint of coal and dark fruits, some coffee. Flavour is light sweet with a moderate to medium roasty bitter finish. Body is medium. Nice level of smoke and high drinkability! Lovely balanced and smooth beer.

Aroma is toasted malts, liquorice, some smoked wet wood and mild earthy notes. Flavour is ripe fruits, ashes, mild coffee, roasted malts and some liquorice. Balanced and tasty one.
Dymový porter s intenzívnou kávovou arómou , nádherným sfarbením a a orgazmickou chuťou na jazyku po dopití , predčil vetky moné očakávania.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 Pours creamy black with a big brown head. Smell of smoked ham, coffee, crisps hops with light hints of fruits, berries, grainy malt toffee. Taste is lightly sweet, light bitterness with a nicely balanced kick of smoke and fruity hops shining through. Light-to-medium body with soft carbonation.< br />
Not extremely smoked, good balance. Love the crisp hops, mixed with grainy malts and the kick of smoke. One of the best, most unique beers from Austria.

Nera, oleosa e con poca schiuma. Tostata, fumosa, legnosa, quasi acre al naso; al palato caffè, liquirizia, malto abbrustolito e un sentore affumicato persistente. Corpo medio, setosa, poco effervescente.
Sample from bottle at Porterfestivalen 2015, Göteborg. Black with off white head. Smoked malt, peat smoke, roasted malt and coffee. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.
Draft. Very good aroma: smoked with roasted barley, hops. Taste: coffee, roasted, hops and cream, tasty. Like!
bottle at home from aleselasmokey savoury bacon meaty toasty roasty malt, rich, full bodied, herbal, tonnes of smokes, tough going at times.
From bottle. Pours black with big, brown head. Chocolate, smoke, coffee, dark malts, resin. Medium to high carbonation, balanced.
330ml bottle. Pours an opaque dark brown, almost black with thin brown head. Aroma is cocoa, espresso, burnt toast, roasted malts. taste is dark chocolate, coffee, BBQ smoke and licorice. very nice.
Bottle in Salzburg Austria, pours black with tan head. Beautiful aroma of smoke and chocolate, taste bitter chocolate and smoked malt, very good.
Bottle.Color black with medium brown head. Aroma smoke, malt, roasted, alcohol. Taste sweet, smoke, malt, alcohol, lactose.

Dark brown with a light beige head. Noses of malts, roasted malts, some caramel, light smoke and herbal. Light tangy with a mild texture and robust body. Light sweetness opens the stage for a building dry roasty soft smokeyness. Medium lasting finish.

Schwarz im Glas, feiner kaffeebrauner Schaum, verflüchtig sich schnell, sehr rauchig in der Nase, relativ leicht im antrunk, gefolgt von sehr rauchigem Abgang, fehlt leider etwas Körper, trotzdem nicht schlecht
Mild rauchiger, deutlich malziger Antrunk. Minimale Süße, eher trocken. Mild herb, spritzig, karamellig. Geringfügig steigende Herbe, mit der Trockenheit auch malziger werdend. Gut. 11/11/11/12//11

Draught at Leijuva Lahna. Black color, white head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, licorice, smoke, a bit of vanilla, dark fruits and nuts. Bitter finish with coffee, smoke, licorice, nuts and dark fruits. Exquisite smoked porter.

Bottle - Black colour, large brown head, lacing. Mild smoke aromas with ashy notes, roasted malts, coffee. Taste of coffee, smoke, chocolate and toffee. Medium body and carbonation, sweet and roasty finish. Well balanced smoked beer. I like it.

Tap at Leijuva Lahna, Helsinki. Colour is black with brownish small head. Aromas and flavours: Smoke, coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Soft warming light smoked porter. Could be heavier but very drinkable.

Bottle. Nose is lovely, soft smoke, Bavarian cheese, a hamper of smoked meats, wet woodland, waft of licorice, slight tobacco. I could smell this all day.

Taste, while nice can not compete with the wonderful nose, smoke, prune, herbal hops, slight chocolate, tobacco, a vegetable, slightly ham taste, slightly soy, strong licorice in the finish. 

Nice beer that I want to sniff all day.

Black color with big, dark brown, thick, long lasting head. Medium body with creamy texture. Strong smokey meat aroma with roasted malt and cocoa notes. Finish is roasted and sweet. Awesome beer, truly what it says Smoked and Porter.
33cl bottle @Koht. Deep black, thick brown head. Smoked meat in aroma, licorice, roastedness. Smoke follows u in the flavor. Smoke, licorice, roastedness. Tasty brew.

Black color with a medium beige head that quickly diminishes. Aroma has roasty notes with black chocolate and some coconut hints. Flavor has notes of coffee beans, chocolate, licorice and ashes with a mild bitterness. Moderate bitterness in the final with roasty mouthfeel in the aftertaste.

Big tan foamy head with very good retention. Clear mahogany colour. Roasted aroma, prune, cocoa, biscuits and smoke notes. Taste is burnt dark fruits, vanilla, and chocolate with smoke notes and slight diacetyl evidence.
A very good smoked porter.

0,33l fles meegebracht uit tallinn en gedeeld met bryanvdv. Zwart met een bruine kraag. Smaak en geur medium rook maar ook duidelijk de zwarte mout met cacao. In de afdronk drop en salmiak. Nice maar body had wat voller mogen zijn.

Bottle 0.33l at The 8th Belgrade tasting Session One at the Beerville Beer Bar.17.07.2015.Thanks ippopotamo36 for this bottle.Ciao Albertoooo.Pour it dark color with small white head.Aroma of black olives.Taste of grains, smoked little bit too much for me, coffee, some herbs and quite sweet finish.

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a small tan head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Nice sweet and bitter tones. Dark chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, dark fruits and some spices. A tasty porter.

Trade from Werckmeister, many thanks! Black with a tan head. Aroma with meaty smokiness, roastiness and some coffee. Sweetish flavor with smokiness, a bit meaty, roasty, a bit of caramel and perfume. Nice aroma, but I think the taste is a bit off.

Tap. Pours black with an off-white head. Smoky aroma. Taste is of smoked malts, fruits, coffee and a hint of licorice. Roasty finish. Smooth and tasty. Almost too drinkable - doesnt even feel like 6.3%.
bottle. Deep black, with a tall beige-brown head. Shy smoky nose. Medium-bodied, lots of roasetd malts, coffee, some bitter chocolate and a touch of smoke.

(bottle 0,33l)
Aroma: Smoke, some malty sweet.
Appearance: Opaque black color. Medium, light brown head.
Taste: Medium sweet, light smoke.
Palate: Medium body. Creamy texture. Long dry finish.
Overall: Nice, smoke and dry.
Bottle from Bar Beerian, Whitefield. Black with next to no head. Smoked with a heavier nose than taste in this respect - theres lots of ham in its aroma. Easy drinking for its strength and tasty.

At the 8th tasting (round 1), held at Vladas Beerville pub in Belgrade-Serbia. Bottle. Pours brownish black color, small off-white head lowering fast. Nose: black olives, a hint of smoked ham-meat. Mouth: round feel of smoked-roasted malts, herbal bitter dry end, not that refined but decent enough.
Tap at BeerHunters, Pori. Dark brown color, good beige head. Woody smokey, malty aroma. Medium-bodied. Smoked, some caramel, vegetables, toasted malty flavor. Unbalanced.

Spina. Appare molto compatta, di colore quasi nero, con tre dita di schiuma beige molto cremosa. Laroma è affumicato, malto torrefatto, note di caffè ed un leggerissimo sentore erbaceo. Gusto deciso, mediamente dolce, bilanciato con una discreta amarezza sul finale; laffumicato corrobora ogni sorsata. Lerbaceo si rivela, seppur limitatamente, sul finale. Corpo medio andante, per una birra non adatta a tutte le occasioni, ma fatta molto bene.

Tap. Pours black with tanned head. Aroma: Roasted Malt, coffee, cocoa. Taste: Medium+ creamy sweetness. Balanced bitterness. Bread. Palate: Medium body, creamy. Leather flavors. Some smoke. Very pleasant.
Nice roasted, smoky and ham aroma. Very drinkable, and balanced beer. You get nice sweetness in mouth.

Appearance: Very dark brown, some dark tan head, though short-lived.
Aroma: Dark malt, smoke. Coffee.
Taste: Dark malt, roasted, some smoke and tar. Burnt bitterness. Good balance. Nice!
Bought: Trade with MarkoNm - thanks!, 330 ml
Info: 20/6-2015, BB: 14/10-2015

Nice blend of chocolate, roasty, spruce, citrus, herbs, dough and smoke. Very dark, almost black, minimal head. Light sweetness, lightly bitter. Full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, medium finish. Suitable for dark winter nights.

(Bottle 0.33l) Trade with Werckmeister. Thanks Stefan! Black colour. Medium sized, brown, creamy, medium fast to slowly falling head. Good lacing. Light to medium body, low carbonation, slightly oily texture. Aroma: Roasted malt, smoky, smoked ham, soft dark chocolate. Taste: Dark malts, roasted, smoky, soft dark chocolate, medium strong, roasted sourness.. Medium long to long, roasted and smoky finish. Rich in aroma, good balanced, tasty.

33cl bottle. Pours dark reddish brown, almost black, with a small beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is smoked, cinder, roastiness, light soy sauce and mineral notes. Similar taste, smoked flavors very well balanced with the malty component. Full body, smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Very good.

Bottle at Brot & Spiele, Graz. Pours very dark with tan head. Nose is roasted malts, dark chocolate, caramel. Taste is rather roasted, coffee, decent hops, dried fruits, light smoke, medium bitterness. I hoped it to be fuller.

Bottle from Geiserich (European Local Swap 2/2015), thanks! Pours black and tan. Aroma: mild campfire smoke, chocolate. Taste: chocolate, wood, campfire smoke, tobacco, vanilla, caramel, liquorice, just a hint of iodine. Moderate light sweet, moderate bitter, medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Nice chocolate-roasty-smoke-wood lingering finish. Great balance. I am (was?) not a fan of smoked beers, but this one sure tastes good! Cheers, Geiserich!
Pitch black color with brown foam. Coffee nose. The taste has particles in a watery coffee solution with quite some smokey notes. The aftertaste is like i imagine dry smoked coffee.

Unclear black beer with a beige head, low carbonation.
Tastes : coffee, smoke, caramel, chocolate, wood and roasted malt.
Very nice label.
Long smoky coffee aftertaste, very tasty!

Black, moderate strong darkish tan creamy head. Aroma of some caramel and chocolate but mostly roasted malts and strong smoke, bit ashy. Taste is low to moderate sweet chocolate, some caramel, roasted malt, some ash with a constant smokey background, dry coffee bitter finish, decent lasting aftertaste. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, bit creamy.
(0,33, Vrutak, Zagreb)

What an amazing beer! Pour dark brown color with a medium brown head. The first thing you will notice is the incredibly well balanced smoked aroma. It is smokey on nose, but still delicate to smell some caramel, dark chocolate, coffee and even herbal notes. The taste is similar, ashy and smokey from the lips to the back of your throat but perfectly balanced in the way that it doesnt obscure the typical coffee and roasted flavours of a good porter. The taste is even better and more complex when you feel some bitterness, herbal and wood notes coming from Slovenian and American hops.
Overall: This is without any doubt one of the best and most complex smoked porters on the market. 
P.S. The label is fantastic and dont forget to try more great beers from Bevog!
Black color with beige head. Ashes, bacon, dark malts, freshness. Taste is dry, oatmeal feeling, herbal-earthy, some coffee and some bitter chocolate. Very nice. Still stays kinda light. Wow!

Aangeraden door Berts Bierhuis in Utrecht. Schenkt een mooi zwart bier met cremekleurige schuimkraag. Geuren van gebrand mout, koffie, chocola, hout. Dit komt ook terug in de smaak. Deze is mooi rond, niet te sterk, zacht maar toch sterk. De bitterheid en rokerigheid in de nasmaak maken dit een heerlijke porter. Niet verwacht van een Oostenrijkse brouwer.

Bottle. Thanks, TimE. Big nostril-filling smoke. Dark brown color. Smoked malt from the get-go, some chocolate behind it, strong dark fruit, a bit ashy in mid and final, good bitter tracks. Smoke is considerable and constant. Well-rounded and very tasty.
Bottle. Great smoky nose, huge umami, chocolate, coffee. Medium smoke in the flavor, soy, umami, chocolate. A bit thin. Nice.
Dark brown color. Huge deep smoked bacon, cheese and chocolate nose. Full body with tons of dark chocolate, smoke and fairly big smokey finish.

Bottiglia 33cl comprata in Slovenia e bevuta a casa.
Nera con bella schiuma.
Amara affumicata e tostata, corpo bello vellutato

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Un nero impenetrabile, con schiuma dal color cappuccino, si restringe abbastanza rapidamente, ma mantiene una buona persistenza. Aroma netto di malto tostato, cioccolato nero, ma soprattutto di carne affumicata. In bocca, primo approccio sorprendentemente rinfrescante, il gusto punta verso lamaro; con sapori di malto tostato, cioccolato, affumicatura, liquirizia, caffè. Perfetta carbonazione e corpo medio-pieno, finale leggermente amaro, tostato e asciutto.

33cl Bottle. Appearance : Almost black
Arroma: Dark malts, smoked sausages.
Taste: Malty seetness, some licorice tones and some smoked sausages, some hops and roastyness in the finish.
thin body, soft carbonation.

Bottle 0.33 l. Dark brown colour with small, beige, long lasting head. Average carbonation. Nice roasted and smoky aroma with hint of dark chocolate. Taste is bitter sweet with just right amount of smoke in the aftertaste. Overall very good, easy drinking porter.

0.33l bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, smoked malt and chocolate. Taste is sweet with slight bitterness and smoked character. Full body and thick body. Overall its great beer with nice balance between smoked malt and roasted notes.

Butelka. Barwa czarna nieprzejrzysta. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, niewysoka, utrzymująca się do samego końca jako niewysoka warstwa. Wędzony aromat na pierwszym planie, paloność, kawa, czekolada. W smaku podobnie. Czuć w ustach poloność, lekka słodycz, delikatna czekolada. Pozostaje w ustach kwaśny posmak. Wycenie niskie.

Bottle, many thanks to Werckmeister. Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je výrazně uzené a lehce uhelné. Pěna je dozlatova, jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je neprůsvitná černá. Jedná se o vcelku dobré nakuřované, lepí ne větina co jsem dosud měl.

0,33l bottle from beerbottle.eu. Smoky, but though mild and smooth. Well-balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Pours black with a small and long lasting head. Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted, some smoked notes. Delicate and smooth in taste with prominent dark chocolate notes, bread, roasted and just a hint of smoke. A very good, easy-drinking porter beer.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 beczka, WFP, na szybko: bardzo fajny aromat, bogaty - jest wedzonka, palonosc, slody, czekolada, kawa, drewno, chleb, kwas chlebowy. w smaku bez poirownania delikatniej, czesc z tych nut zanika (wedzonosc ledwo w smaku wyczuwalna), kwaskowate, z lekka goryczka. fajne piwo. mile w piciu, malo ciala, Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle. Dark pour. Aroma of smoke, licorice and cacao. Taste of smoke, bacon, licorice and some hop bitters in the finish. Good body, soft mouthfeel. Good beer.

Bottle. Almost black. Malt, beachwood and fat sausage in the lovely aroma. Malty sweetish flavor with licorice and hints of sausage and smoke. The flavor is less convincing as the aroma. Roasty finish.

Bottle shared at a smoked beer tasting at our place. Black with a tan head. Rich roasted and smoky aroma with a little chocolate. A little sweet, roasty and phenolic taste. Medium body, a little fizz, roasty and woodsy finish/

Bottle sample at a tasting at kerenmks place. Thanks kerenmk. Black with a tan head. Aroma with meaty smokiness, roastiness and some coffee. Sweetish flavor with smokiness, a bit meaty, roasty, a bit of caramel. Medium-bodied. Good stuff.

Bottle; pours dark brown with a khaki head; smoky aroma with chocolate, caramel, and a hint of roasted malt; taste is very smoky with some chocolate, caramel, and wood; finish is dry with a light smoky bitter; body is a little thin for me in a porter but this is still pretty good

Bottle @ Tuulensuu, Tampere, Finland. Medium aroma with sour smokyness and bit of dark fruits. Black color w medium/small light beige head. Medium taste with coffee, bit roasted malts and some bitter notes all nicely flavored with with organic smoke. Balanced. Wide taste spectrum and long smoky malty aftertaste. Medium/light body with medium/low carbonation. Overall high quality and organic but too low in every area.

Bottle. Pitch black with beige, densed big head. Medium lacing and head retention. Pleasent smoked meat aromas (not too heavy), lots of black chocolate, red fruits. Nice smoke flavours with light black chocolate, also some roasted malts, which are noticable in the end of degustation. Medium body, creamy texture, medium carbonation. Finish is bitter, dry and roasted malts. Slightly alcohol warmimg. In general very nice, well balanced smoked porter, highly drinkable. May be for smoked beer geeks it can be not enough.
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2016 Black brown with a medium head. Aroma is smoke, roasty malts, hops. taste of roasted malt, smoked pork, dark fruits and with dry finish.

Linköping Beer Expo 2015. Dark amber/brown beer with a rich offwhite/beige head. Roasted chocolate and smoke aroma, caramel, fruity, some licorice. Chocolate and smoke flavor, licorice, caramel, raisins, some burnt wood. Slightly thin bodied but a nice beer.

Bottle from Secret Santa Winter 2014. Pours near opaque black with a medium, frothy beige head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is heavy smoke, roast malt, earthy hops, dates and prunes with nutty malt notes. Flavor is dark malt, smoked meat, dark fruits, light earthy hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Kolor: Czarny, nieprzejrzysty.
Piana: Obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, koloru beżowego. Trwała, świetny lacing - na szkle układają się piękne firanki, które odmierzają każdy łyk.
Aromat: Dymu z ogniska. Paloność plus lekka wędzonka, a pod spodem czekolada. Rewelacja.
Smak: Odrobina słodyczy, wyraźna paloność i odrobina wędzonki. Jakby ktoś zabutelkował dym z ogniska. Do tego średnia, kakaowa goryczka i odrobina czekolady. Super.
Wysycenie: Niskie do średniego. W porządku.
Opakowanie: Genialna etykieta - dzieło sztuki. Brak informacji o zasypie, chmieleniu i drożdżach, jak zwykle na minus.

Doskonałe piwo. Szczerze polecam. Jedne z najlepszych jakie piłem.

Bottle. Dark black with medium brown head. Aroma of snoked malts, roasted nuts, smoked cheese, bread, dark chocolate, caramel. Taste is light acidic, light sweet with notes of smoked malt. Dry, medium body, flat carbonation. Kinda astringent finish for me. Decent.

33cl bottle bb10/2015, danke werckmeister. Velvet black-brown pour. Odd smoked vegetal aromas, maroni mousse and grilled cucumber, notes of dill, beef jerky and oats meet more dessert typical roast. Smooth drinking, catering dry Snickers caramel and chocolate to a robust porter hop shake with rich liquorice. On point, with a memorable odd touch.

Keg at The Cellar, Chester. Darkest brown. Slight tan head. Aroma is pretty good. Smoky, earthy, coffee bean, red fruit. Taste is toasted bread, chocolate, hint of vanilla, and of course a nice well done smokiness. Finishes a bit dry. Strong body. Solid stuff.
black to brown body...brown head...the smokiness is too big... is a good beer anyway

Aroma toast, roasty, soy sauce, smoke, 
Appearance dark brown, clear, tan foam, frothy, 
Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, 
Palate light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,

330ml bottle shared by intsr. Appearance: dark red, almost black liquid with frothy tan head. Aroma: smoky, chocolate, bread, caramel, alcohol. Taste: tar, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long bitter finish,
Bottle at Örebro Ölcafé. Smoky peated smell with dark malts and chocolate. Similar taste. It has a "wood fire smoke"-aroma. Smooth mouthfeel.

Keg at Mother Kellys, Bethnal Green, London. A black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty, smoke aroma. Tastes similar roasty, malty, smoke, some chocolate in there too. Good one.
Sorry, folks, this is just too much of everything: Malt, smokey flavour, Caramel. Carbonation is OK, lacks some acidity. OK beer.

330 mml bottle tasted on the 23/02/2015. Black opaque colour with a medium creamy beige head. Aroma of black chocolate, roasted malts, smoked meat. Taste is sweet and dry with presence of chocolate and roasted malts. Some liquorice on the paladar. Medium body and sweet finish. Next one please!

The best Beer for me :)

Bottle is great, but Tap is outstanding :)

(Bevog Ond Smoked Porter) Bottle 330 ml, thanks to Sebiinz! Served into a snifter, ABV 6.3%
Dark brown colour on the body, one finger of brown thick head on top. Good retention, medium lacing on the glass.
Light smoke on the aroma and lots of chocolate.
Taste is the opposite, lots of smoke, lighter chocolate, finishes with roasted malts and light coal.
Medium body, good levels of carbonation.
Another good beer from Bevog.

Draught @ Haket. Pours dark blackish brown with a rather small beige head that leaves some thick lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and smokey with roasted malts, burnt caramel, smoked meat, moist soil and hints of ash. Taste is slightly bitter and malty with roasted malts, smoke, minerals, moist soil, ash, burnt wood and hints of metal. Mouthfeel is slightly dry, slightly roasted astringent and medium bodied. Finish is bitter with roasted malts, burnt caramel, smoke, moist soil, minerals, hay and ash. Not much to say about this. Goes down easily but the label is far more interesting than the beer...

Bottle from the York Beer & Wine Shop. Pours black with tan froth. The taste is a little acidic sharpness to begin with. Burnt notes come in after with caramel. Plenty of woody flavour too. Thin in body. Id hoped for more from this.

Bottle from my european secret santa. Pours pitch black with a big creamy beige head. Aroma of light roasted malts, weak intriguing smoke.Taste is light sweet, dark malts, easy comfy smoke, more chocolate and roast, a very nice one.
Bottle 0,33l. Dark liquid with tan foam. Full body, light carbonation. Lightly smoked, caramel. Tasty and creamy.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

.33l bottle @Harrys 
Pours pitch black with low head. Aroma is smoked ham, pure smoke, malts, ham and some hops. Flavor is smoke, hops, dark malts, ham and spices. Swell!
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en tienda XXXII. Color negro. Sabor a malta tostada, regaliz, bacon ahumado.
Botella. @XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine. ............. .... Sevilla 27/12/2014
Overall: Sweet roasted bread, smoked meat, dried figs.Note: On-tap at Malt och Humle. Reviewed 2014-12-23.

Appearance: Black as the deepest dungeon. A nice big beige head that leaves a fine lacing.Aroma: Dark malt, mild smoked and roasted malt.Palate: Medium (+) body. Tad sweet with an ok bitterness. Average to soft carbonation. Oily texture.Taste: Dark malt, roasted malt, some chocolate and mild smoked.Overall impression: Pleasant and nice smoked beer. Would have loved some nice food with this one.Personal stats: Bottle shared by Visionthing

33cl bottle from Drink Shop, Tallinn. Pours almost completely black with a modest, but lasting beige head. Aroma of roasted malt with mild smoky notes, chocolate, hints of coffee, wood and smoked pig. Medium sweet with nice roasty flavours and a balanced smokiness. Finishes lightly bitter with some herbal notes. Very well balanced and quite delicious!
330ml bottle, thanks to Geiserich. Pours a deep hazy dark colour. Aroma is smoky. Taste has mild smoky elements, a touch of chocolate and a soft bitterness. Nice smoked porter.

Bottle. Dark brown, nearly black. Medium but frothy brown head. Aroma of wood, earth, tobacco, dark chocolate, some fresh bandages. Taste is a nice balance between roasty sourness and malty sweetness. All in all is quite dry. Mouthfeel is quite full, bit oily. Nice beer.
Tap @ Tuulensuu. Pours black with a beige head. Smoky ham, roasted malts in the aroma. Smoke, sweet, malty, coffee in the flavor. A bit thin bit nice.
271114. Tap at Tuulensuu, Tampere. Pours black with a nice head. Aroma smoke, roasted malts, hops. Dry surprisingly light palate. Not Bad.
black. bubbly coffee colored head. unfiltered. smells of milk chocolate, light chocolate, subtle smoke. medium to full body. subtle smokyness and medium bitterness on the finish.

Butelka 0.33L.
Wygląd: Czarne, beżowa, obfita, drobno pęcherzykowa piana, trwała i ładnie firankuje.
Aromat: Wyraźna wędzoność bukiem, która dominuje w aromacie. W tle czuć czekoladę i lekką stęchliznę oraz lekko kwaśną nutę chlebową.
Odczucie: Wysycenie niskie do średniego, ciało średnie, faktura kremowa.
Smak: Mocno palone, wędzoność tutaj dużo mniej wyczuwalna. Sporo chmielu, nut ziemistych, drzewnych oraz tytoniowych. Goryczka średnia do wysokiej, długa.
Całość: Dobre piwo ale w aromacie wędzoność dominuje a w smaku dominuje paloność i chmiel.

Malty-intense beginning. Fresh, smooth, dry. Roasted, malty, slightly sourish, full bodied, not too smokey. 
Nice bitter-malty finish, not too intense, not too dry. Fresh, earthy-deep. Intense malty-roasted. Thick and great!
Poured reddish brown with a huge frothy tan head. Aroma of roast malt, dark fruit and dark chocolate. Medium body, quite smooth, flavour is dry rauched malt, chocolate, coffee.
Smell of smoke, tar. Black with brown head. Aroma of smoke, tar, cocoa. Very flat carbon, slightly oily but mostly ashy texture. Medium bitter.

33cl bottle @Bregüer, Valladolid. 23-03-2014.
In short: smoky dark ale
Pours very dark with nice tan head, moderate head retention, good lacing. Smoky, liquorice, wood, roasty aromas. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is smoky, roasty, liquorice, wood. Pleasant.
From tap. Pours dark with a reddish tinge. Nose has smoke and burnt malt. Aroma follows suit. Taste has burnt bitterness with some hints of sweetness.

0,33 l bottle from Biervana BB 25. Feb 15 

brown, hazy, frothy, brown foam, caramel, chocolate, cereal, roasty, toast, nuts, coffee, smoke, light sweetness, medium bitterness, salty, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

(Keg at Black Door, 20141104) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had liquorice, sweetness and bunt malts. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were liquorice, burnt malts, fruitiness and bitterness. Aftertaste was burnt and bitter. A beer that wasnt too burnt.

Draught. Dark brown, tan head. Smoked ham, salty licorice and bit of old leather in aroma. Nice and smooth mouthfeel. Smoky notes, minerals and dark, slightly bitter chocolatey notes in taste. Like drinking black velvet with a smoky touch, me likes. Thumbs up for this one. Campfire and really dark chocolatecake with some bitter notes in aftertaste.
Bottle from drink shop, tallinn. Black color, brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee. Roasty body, coffee, some smoke, some hops at the end.

Bottle @Bir & Fud Bottega (Rome). Nera, densa, impenetrabile, schiuma media color cappuccino, poco persistente. Al naso sentori caffettosi e di bacon, leggera punta metallica che svanisce pian piano, ma nel complesso un gran bellaroma! In bocca ha molta sostanza, attacco cioccolatoso molto breve, quindi si vira sul caffettoso, con finale leggermente affumicato, molto ben equilibrata. Corpo medio, carbonazione medio-bassa. Molto buona.

Fľaa. Čierna farba, nahnedlá pena, drala pomerne dlho. Vôňa praených sladov, horkej čokolády, kakaa a samozrejme údenosti. UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 Draught at the brewery. Black with reddish brown tint, beige strong lasting frothy head. Red fruit cake and smoke aromas, refreshing, retronasal smoke, very well balanced, not to much smoke, aromas of nuts, earth and wood. Very drinkable and tasty. Great!
Se anche i nostri amici doltralpe da parte austriaca riescono a sfornare un ottima smoked come questa, allora cè speranza...

Bottle from Tallinna Kaubamaja ( 4,35) in Oct 2014. BB 07.08.15. What a wacky label. The beer pours a deep dark brown and appears black in the glass with no light penetrating it. Head is massive, thick, tan, retains and laces nicely. Aroma is indeed smoky as in smoked plums (not the smoked ham thing as with most smoked beers Ive had), but also a chocolaty note coming through the thick smokiness. Taste roasty-chocolaty-smoky-sweet and quite bitter - all nicely balanced. Body surprisingly light, low carbonation, palate somewhat dry. Wouldve loved a bit of a thicker body and more carbonation. Otherwise good to enjoy in a cold autumn evening.

Bottled. Black beer, frothy and lacy mocha head. Strong aroma of smoked grains, "meaty, mixed bread, hints of chocolate. Fruity and slightly sweetly herbal hop aromas. Sturdy, dryish bready malt flavor. Chocolatey and slightly sour roastedness accumulates in the finish together with herbal bitterness and some dark fruitiness. Long lasting, smoky and chocolatey aftertaste. Medium body, slick and slightly oily texture. Very well balanced beer.
Mikon luona. The body is a bit thin, still very drinkable. Not as smoky as some of its kind, more like an roasted baltic porter feeling.
On draft. Black with fluffy beige head. Roasted coffee aroma. Taste is similar, but with a hint of chocolate and some smokiness. Ends dry. Great one.

Bottle from Borut, thanks! Sweet smoked plums in chocolate coating. At some moments it makes a more smokey impression, at other points it resembles chocolate cake above all. The taste is less sweet than expected after the aroma, with the light sweetness partly subdued by the bitterness and in part by dry smokey notes. The beer however is not dry and rather fullish. A slow sipper invoking images of wood, bonfires and the tough yet rewarding life of a woodcutter. Great stuff.
Bottle. Dark red-brown with a tan head. The aroma has chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and smoke. The flavour is sweet chocolate, liquorice, smoke. Pretty flat. Maybe Im just feeling blue today.

Bottle from deeside drinks emporium. Pours an almost jet black with a thick frothy beige head which lasts. First aroma you get is a definite oak smoked ham. There is some bonfire in there too. Taste has burnt ham and toasted malts. Not a bad smoked porter but there are far better out there.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2015 Completely dark, small tan head. Roasted malts, bacon and ham, some caramel, chocolate and vanilla. Thin to medium body, soft carbonation. Texture is creamy and oily. Big and long coffee bitter finish. This one is just great.
(Za Popen?t 0,33l bottle)
Lovely smoked porter, with a nice hint of sweetness to it..........................
330ml bottle. Smoke. Smoke. Bacon. A bit dark berries. Appearance is black with a nice brown-ish head. Taste is light sour and sweet. A bit watery. A good carbonation. Very good.

Aroma: toasted malts, beacon, salty, smoked. Appearance: dark brown/black, medium creamy beige head. Taste: light bitter, umami. Palate: toasted notes coming up, remains light bitter, light smoked/toasted malts, but not dominating. Overall: light smoked, reminds more of a Porter with some savoury aroma, but very nice. Bottle from Independent Spirit, Bath.

33cl bottle @ home, gift from Csak a Jó Sör - Only Good Beer, Budapest, many thanks! Nearly black color, medium creamy brown mostly lasting excellent lacing head. Aroma moderated smoke and dark roasted malt in the nose, dark chocolate, coffee, moderated smoke, bread, old wood, tobacco, later hops, quinine, great balance. Taste pure medium to heavy bitterness. Medium to full body, dry texture, soft carbonation, medium to long lasting roasted bitter later more and more hoppy bitter finish. Delicious moderated well balanced dessert beer.

Nem túl sűrű de sötét. Habja nem túl tartós, vékony. Visszafogottan füstös, barna kenyeres és kellemesen rumosdió édeskés illattal. Nem túl testes de csípős az alkoholtól. Gyógyfüves keserűség kicsit híg befejezéssel. Nem érzek semmi különlegeset de jó porter.

Bottle, BBE 27/02/15. Pours black with a nice-looking, dark-latte colored head. Aroma is smoky and tarry, somewhat roasted lightly salty liquorice. Perhaps even ashy. Taste is roast and smoke, some liquorice, light coffee. Surprisingly light, medium carbonation. Not as great as I was expecting going by everything said about it.
Pours dark brown with medium tan head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, smoke, roasted malts, some coffee. Sweet smokey with bitter notes. Pretty good one.

Bottle. Almost black with big beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, little smoke and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, medium sweet, little smoke, little liquorice, caramel, hop and medium bitter.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Almost black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and smoked meat. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. Nice and simple. 280714
Bottle. Huge tan head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, little smoke, little wood, chocolate and hops. Nice dry semi bitter finish.

Black with a massive beige head. Aroma of smoke, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, yeast. Taste is light sweet, with a sour and bitter finish. Thin oily texture, medium carbonation, perhaps over‐carbonated for the style. Good beer.
Robust porter flavor of subtle chocolate and berry with nice complementary smoke. Excellent representation of the style.
Bottle from York Beer & Wine. An inky black beer with a sour red fruit and chocolate flavour, smoked and liquorice notes with dry coffee on the finish. Very nice!

Bottle. Black, tan head. Lovely soft smoky, soft roasty nose. Some milk chocolate there too. Really a nice balanced nose- beechwood smoke, chocolate. Soft smooth body, medium full. Nice texture, not too oily nor dry. Could be a bit more intensive, but real nice like this too.
Fine balanced smoke beer with great color, good foam, lacks a little fullness.
Bottle, 330 ml from Za Popent, Ljubljana. Pours black with brown head. Smoked, roasted malts aroma and flavor. Some chocolate can be tasted as well.
Black to brown body, brown head. Aroma has nice sweetness, but the smokiness is big. Flavour is intense, turns to tar. Sweet and oily palate. Maybe too strong smoke for me.

33cl bottle from Cork and Cask. 
Appearance - olive black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - liquorice and smoke. Some toffee in there too. 
Taste - smoky chocolate and liquorice. Some burnt treacle too. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry and smoky finish. 
Overall - nicely balanced with some layers of complexity too.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2016 Black color, average sized brown head. Some lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate, smoke, coffee, hops. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Texture is oily. Smokey taste, ham, dark chocolate, roasted malt, hint of coffee. Very, very smooth. Medium sweet taste with light bitterness. Finish is just lightly bitter, but very long and pleasant. Wonderfully complex beer. Hats off!
Dark black with persistent beige head. Aromas of smoke and hops. Taste medium saline, light bitter and sourness. Not overpoweringly smoky as some can be. Very good.
Pleasant coffee and roasted malts aroma. Head disappearing to durable layer with nice lacing. Almost completely black colour. Great roastiness and coffee in taste with a bit of hoppy bitterness.
Dark black beer, with thick off white head. The head masks the aroma of the beer, apart from its smokeness, but the flavour is superb. Balance of smoke, sweet malt and porter bitterness. Great beer.
Nem tudtam mire kell számítsak, ismeretlen volt számomra ez a sörfajta. Nem lett kedvencem, de ettől még a műfaj kedvelőinek tetszhet. Semmi különöset nem adott nekem.
Polecam. Porzadny dymiony porter. Lekko goryczkowy, wyraźnie czuć dym. Przyjemny w smaku.

Barwa: czarna, nieprzejrzysta nawet pod światło. Piana beżowa/ jasno brązowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, średniej wielkości, utrzymująca się i ładnie oblepiająca szkło. [5/5]

Aromat: palone i wędzone torfem słody, czekolada gorzka, kawa. Po chwili pojawiają się nuty bardziej słodkie - cappuccino, płatki owsiane, wanilia. 

Smak: początkowo kwaskowość z ciemnych słodów, jednak prawie natychmiast występuje palona i wędzona kontra. Trochę melanoidymów, czekolady, raczej wytrawny i pełny smak. Lekko alkoholowa i rozgrzewająca końcówka.

Keg at The Hanging Bat. With my ma who surprisingly enough loved it. Pours Black with a tan head. I tend to shy away from Rauch but when its applied to a stout I find it really appealing. Velvety porter wrapped in ashy smoke. Works really well.
Bottle at Craigs. Dry and smoky, dark roast, some chocolate, bitter, sweet.

Tapped at Bevog. Brown color with beige head. Smoke, coffee in aroma. In flavor also ash and alcohol. Medium body with oily texture. Pleasant bitter finish.

Tap at brewery. Almost black color with thick beige head. Nice smoked aroma with campfire, bacon, saussages. Taste, roasted malt, coffee, bacon, smoked saussages, charcoal. Long smoky finish.

Tap at the Brewpub. Aroma is empathically smoky. Moderately roasty. Light fruity, plums. Very dark colour, stable beige head. Taste has bold smoke too. Then roasted, chocolate. Very chewy mouthfeel, yet very smooth. Long smoky roasty finish. Very good.
Long lasting full bodied taste, chocolate, roasted malts, dark, lively carbonation, brown head, slight acidic notes, well balanced, interesting beer - good job....

bottle bought at craftbeerfest vienna. Aroma of roasted malt, smoked ham, wood, coffee. Taste smoky and coffee, fruity, ashes, dark chocolate, Long lasting aftertaste of roasted coffee and bitterness. Great Porter!

Bottle in Italy. Dark brown pour, foamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, smokey, licorice, molasses and some coffee. Flavor is quite bitter, roasted and with a very thick body for the relatively low ABV. Very nice brew.

Bottle @ DØE Meeting. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, light caramel, light smoke, bacon, little rubber, tart dark fruits. Flavor is malty, caramel, peat, wood, smoked ham, little dark fruits. Medium body, lively carbonation, dry smoked finish. 210514
Bottle from Brewtique, Macclesfield. Dark brown to black with a medium off white head. Aroma is smokey roasted malts, quite subtle. Flavour is like bacon sex. Not bad, enjoyed this.

330 ml bottle. BB 15/07/2014. From Geiserich. Thanks a lot Michael!
Black colour with a small light brown head. 
Smoked, roasted malt, mild berries, mild bitterness and dark chocolate in the aroma. The flavour is strong ashy dryness, berries, hoppy bitterness, strong smoke, tar and woody dryness. Complex. Nice label.

Bottle 330ml. @ cgarvieuk [ Lets do a chrisO Tasting ], Edinburgh, Scotland. [ As Bevog Ond ].Clear light dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, smoke. Flavour is moderate sweet and light moderate bitter with a average duration, roasted, smoke, vegetables. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140315]

Tap at The Hanging Bat. Pours dark brown/black with a red edge. Aroma is toasty with coffee, grass, light meaty smokiness. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Teriyaki, soy, coffee, hint of balsamic. Medium bitterness. OK.

Bottle @ ild og røg ølsmagning. Dark brown, small tan head, nice lacing. Aroma, malty, roasted notes, caramel. Taste, roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, little smoke. Thin body. Medium carbonation. Really nice long aftertaste, with a nice smoke taste in the end.

Ottima smoked porter con un corpo denso e oleoso, colore nero impenetrabile, naso di caffé e affumicato, gusto sominato da note di caffé, cioccolato, malti tostati, unintensa sfumatura affumicata e leggermente legnosa. Davvero buona!
Sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, rauchig, Schinken, Kaffee. Geschmack nach Kaffee, Röstmalz, holzig, dunkle reife Früchte.

Really nice smoked porter! On tap at Strefa Piwa stand at Wroclaw Good Beer Festival. Aroma delicate with notes of coffee latte, cocoa. Taste: roasted coffee and cocoa, nice soft milk-like texture. Lacking a bit of smokyness. Very drinkable.

Ciemne piwo o ładnej kremowiej piwanie. W aromacie gorzka czekolada przeplata się z lekkimi nutami wędzonymi. W smaku złożone: wyraźnie palone, czekoladowe, karmelowe, delikatnie owocowe ze średnio-intensywną wędzonością.

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty smoky chocolate and caramel aroma. Roasted malty smoky chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty smoky chocolate finish.
Pours a jet black with tan head. Aroma is roasted malts,cocoa,smoke. Taste is dark chocolate,roasted and smoky malts.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with tan head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is intense chocolate, smoke, fruits, some sour notes and some alcohol. Taste is fruits, roast, smoke and dark chocolate. Overall: nice brew.

Black color, small brown head. Aroma of smoke, bacon, roast and chocolate. Taste has smoke, coffee, wood, roasted malt, hops - dry sweet with medium bitter hoppy finish and smoked roasty aftertaste. Medium body and soft carbonation. Very good smoked stout.

16th April 2014Opaque black - brown beer, big fluffy pale tan head. Palate is pretty light and minerally crisp. Mild dark malts, lightly tangy. Fairly strong smoke. Light finish. Okay but strongly smoky.

Bottle shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Dark brown, beige head. Nose is chocolate, malt, fruity hops, roast, willow smoky sourness. Flavour is willow smoke, roast, sweetness, coffee, chocolate, hops. Hoppy bitterness in the finish. Light to medium palate, medium body.

Draft. A black beer with a lazing brown head. The aroma has notes of smoke, alcohol, and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of smoke, roasted malt, ash, and alcohol, leading to a bitter finish.
From tap. Pours pitch black with a small tan to brown head. Chocolate malty and roasted. Bitter, mild citric and dry smoked to meaty. Bitter and slight citric. Smoked finish.
At BBF. Black colour with beige head. Smoked aroma. Smoked, roasted taste. Light to medium body.
Pours an opaque black with a beige head. Dry with aromas of smoked- and roasted malts. Hints of coffee and leather. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish with more roasted malts in the end.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Black colored with a small beige head.
Light roasted aroma of smoke, licorice and tobacco.
Sweet and light roasted flavor of smoke, licorice and hops.
Light roasted finish.

Tap. Pours black with an average, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, herbal hops and smoke. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. A very nice Smoked.

Draught at Mikkeller&Friends. Black - offwhite head.
Burned malts. Smokey. Some bitterness. Soapy notes. Dry burnes malty. Ok.

Bottle from Vino Wines. Black body with a thick beige head. Great lacing. Aroma of smoke, wood and ham. Powerful flavour of charcoal, ash and wood. Thin body with a slick, oily mouthfeel. A deep, smokey Porter. Nice.

This is the third beer from the Bevog brewery I have tried and I must say that it keeps up with the quality of the others! This is fantastic, very dark with pale tan head, rich smoky aroma. Full of toasted malts, bitter chocolate, smoked ham type flavours finishing with a long bitter woody type note. Flipping lovely stuff!

Bottle. Cool label. Very dark body with a tall rocky head. Smoky aroma with some cocoa beans. Smooth oily mouthfeel with hints of black bread and smoked ham. Dark malty finish with a balanced roast bitterness. So moreish yet well drinkable.

Bottle shared by Dutchdrebus @ weekly tasting. Very dark brown to black color, average sized medium brown head. Smell malts, smoked, a sourish smokey touch and dark malts. Taste malts, lightly roasty, smoke, bitter. Medium body and carbonation. Very nicely balanced and one of the best smoked beers Ive had. Very nice!

Bottle @ joes shared by me. Pitch black colour with a small to medium sized beige to light brown head. Smells smoked, smoked trout, slightly bacon, slightly salty, slightly peat and earth, some coffee and some chocolate. Tastes smoked, very bitter, roasty, coffee, slightly sourish but that may also be a crazy amount of bitterness. Medium to full body, soft carbo.
@ The Lets do a Chris O tasting. Smokey and oak-y and then that is it. I must be missing something about this beer when you look at the scores it gets, i just dont get it.

330ml bottle (Koht, Tallinn)
Lovely smokey aroma, but theres a chocolatiness that is prepared to play tug of war with the smoke. Black, small brief tight head. A 4+ look, but as the label is fantastic Ill give a "like the look of the bottle" boost to overall. Palate pleasantly not too heavy, robust porter nails the style. Nice balance of roast and smoke, but doesnt quite nail it. Burntness and bitterness make the palate a little aggressive at times. Finish dry and burnt, and bitter. All in all a very solid smoked, but Marduk was right its a little heavy going if youve got the whole bottle to yourself.

Smoke on the waterrrrr....
Smoke+roasted malts+chocolate.
Great balance between hops and smoke.

Draught.
Colour is black with a small dark brown head on its top, which laces and leaves a thin film behind.
Complex nose of smoke, chocolate, pine and dried cherries.
Aroma brings the same combined with caramel, mouthfeel is slick to oily.
Finish is long and dry escorted distinctly by dark choco and resiny hops underpainted by smoke, tart fruits and warming alcohol.
Refined, very nice.

330ml bottle. Pitch black color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Smoke, peat, slight rubber, mild roast and buttery aroma. Deep roast, ashy, peat, more peat in taste. Fills your mouth. Excellent roasted aftertaste. Fabulous beer.

Singing complex smokey roasty penetrating nose. Big thick creamy rocky tan head with thick drifting lacing. Slick Medium sap, smooth Meaty roast to taste with some trace of tartness & some soft chalking. Smoke is soft but complex with finesse. Super craftsmanship.

Color negro , espuma beige densa. Aromas ahumados intensos, chocolate y tostados. la textura es ligera, algo aguada, con sabores tostados y ahumados amargos y secos que perduran hasta el regusto. Rica.

BOTTLE 33CL from Beerhunter. Danke schon, Hans Peter!

Look: pitch black with a big beige-orange head with good retention.
Aroma: smoked sausages, umami, salty, some sweet notes (licorice?), yeast.
Taste: moderate roast, light fruit sweetness followed by roast acidity, coffee, ash and hop bitterness. Excellent!

330ml bottle, courtesy of Craig, very dark colour, heavy sweet and smoky aroma, little fizzy, wee carmel taste and alcoholic finish, all flavours are distributed equally though into perfect composition so stronger accent at the end is very nice

330ml bottle from Valhallas Goat. Almost black with a big beige foamy head. Fruity coffee aroma.Spicy toasted coffee malt flavour. Spicy chocolatey aftertaste. Complex and sophicated but quite light smoked porter.

33 cl bottle.
Pours black color with a large off-white head. Aroma is very smoky and roasty, some caramel, mild ham and dark malts. Flavor is malty and resinous, some roasted notes, chocolate and distant coffee hints. Somewhat creamy and dry palate. Very pleasant and tasty.
4426

33 cl bottle @ olio, BBE 13.10.2014
Aroma is somewhat smoky and peaty with hay and licorice. Flavour has smoked ham, peat and salty licorice. Finishes with herbal tones. Foamy palate. A tad too salty but rather nice still.

330ml bottle

Pours pitch black with a thick light brown head. Aroma of smoked ham, leather, roastiness, grassy fruits, herbal notes, some wood and tar. Taste is smooth, mildly smoked and woody with some herbal grassy notes, leather, licorice and tar. Finish is smooth, hoppy and roasty with some smoked notes, licorice and coffee. Quite nicely balanced, smooth and mildly smoked porter.

Absolutely black colour like engine oil. Huge, creamy and long lasting head with perfect lacing. Awesome view! Intensive aroma of smoke, wood and coffee. Taste is rich and balance full of roasted note, coffee, smoked wood, and vanilla. Perfect balance of sweetness and bitterness. Soft carbonation. Full body. Fantastic smoked porter! Must to try!

Pours a nearly opaque tar black with nut brown head. Very smooth smoke aroma with sweet earthy notes. Malty flavour with initial sweetness offset by carbonation and limited hop presence and balanced sourness. Mouthfeel enduringly smooth, despite prickly early carbonation, leaves a very savoury aftertaste. Pretty complex; smoke predominates, but offers a lot of everything.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a pitch black colour with a white head. Aroma is quite rich and intriguing with roastiness, smoked wood, minerals, lake water and black trumpet mushrooms. Very earthy. Flavour of roasted malts, (again) black trumpet mushrooms, tart wooden notes, mellow toffee sweetness, grassy bitterness and chocolate. Full bodied, smooth mouthfeel and a bitter, dry, wooden and earthy finish. A complex beer, I like it.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2014 
Look: Light pour with beautiful, huge, thick (very small bubbles), billowy, mocha head. Very slow but good looking retention (mountains; slow breakdown of large bubbles), leaves quite some sticky lacing when it goes down and a creamy top layer awaits at the end. Clear, dark brown, but cant really see through. Looks good. 


Smell: Most dominant is a very smooth, charcoal smoke with light bacon. Malt presence combines light sweetness from mostly milk chocolate and light roast, coffee. Also some herbal hop freshness with wood and mineral, maybe a bit of vanilla. Smoothness of the smoke is impressive. 


Taste: Roast rises a bit, hints of dark fruit esters and light sour keeps it fresh. Medium dark malt sweetness, mostly milk chocolate with some caramel, roast and smokiness in the middle. It goes to charcoal smoke, roast and dark coffee medium bitterness + light noble hops. Bitterness stays for a while. Also some caramel and chocolate sweetness linger on the lips when the time goes by.


Mouthfeel: Heavier medium body, very creamy feeling with gentle carbonation. Well done. Leaves a dry, coating finish. 


Overall: Smooth, creamy, smokey ride with strong porter backbone and a good bitter kick at the end. Complexity and balance are there, recommended.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black, thin tan head. Aromas of roasted malt and light smoke. Tastes has more roastiness and light smoke. A bit thin, but OK.
Bottle. Balck with tan head. Aroma is smokey with some molasses. Taste is smokey and roasty, bonfire smoke, quite balamced and pleasant. Tad thin but nice

bottle at home ... at the Lets do a Chris O tasting...deep black ... thin tan head ... dark roast ... lightest smoke ...dark malts nose... deep malts ... soft roast ... quite a heavy smoke ... soft chocolate

deep dark colour, huge, creamy and long lasting brown head; well balanced aroma of smoke and roasted malt,with some coffee and maybe chocolate;taste is less complex for me: smoked and roasted malt; would be much better if its taste was less one-dimensional

Solid black with a foamy lacy, sticky, tan, lasting head. Beautiful. Smells of raisins, vanilla, smoked malt, chocolate and sweet malt. Medium oily body. Dry. Tastes of a nice Mild with roast and raisins but with a clear smokey burnt quality on the light bitter finish. Super drinkable and brings me back for more.

On tap. Black with rocky long lasting beige head, good lacing. In aroma: roasted malts with smoked. In taste: smoked, caramel and roasted malsts. Medium body which is huge advantage in this kind of beer. Very drinkable.

Dark brown black colour, tan head. Light smoky aroma, chocolate, roasted malts, caramel. Quite creamy. Bitter toasted malts, chocolate, quite sweet, smoky, lapsang souchong. Sweet smoky finish. Nice!!
(from 33cL bottle shared @ Emelisse terugkomdag)

Bottle

Bottle. Aroma:smoke, coffee, roasty, dark bread, roased malts. Great, creamy head nicely lacing glass.Taste: coffee, chocolate, ash. smoked medium bitterness, oily feel, full body, long roasty finish. great beer.

Aroma: nice smoked notes, dark malts and chocolate
Appearance: black color and huge lasting beige head -- amazing view.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours an opaque black with a creamy and lacing light brown head. Hard roast aroma with a distinct smokiness. Smoky notes alright, but not enough to define this as a Smoked here on RB. 180214

Pours a completely deep black color. There is a very generous and long lasting brown head.

The taste is quite bitter, creamy with slight addition of coffee. 
A very nice, strong tasting, filling beer. Great work.

Black with a medium sized beige head. Aroma had burned malt, smoke and espresso. Flavour had smoke, burned malt, dark bitter chocolate, hops and espresso. Perfect balance. Solid body. Dry and bitter finish. Nice!

Shared a 33cl bottle from a friend. Pours a black colour with a thin tan lacing. Aroma is smoke, coffee and leather. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is bitter and medium sweet with a long dry finish. Overall, an amazing beer with a bit leather too much.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2013 Bottle black body with brown head. Aroma is coffee, dried fruits roasted malts with not to much smoke one of the nicest aromas i head so far taste is roasted malt liquorice some dark fruits aftertaste is medium bitter. Great brew.

Bottled, 0.33l. Murky dark brown, almost black, color with large creamy light brown mostly lasting head, fair lacing and many tiny yeast particles. Aroma of heavily roasted malt, smoke, strong coffee, dark chocolate, mild caramel, light resiny hops and mild vegetables. Taste starts light sweet malty with heavy roasty and smokey notesy, then followed sourish grainy. Finish is moderate to heavy bitter, aftertaste is long spicy roasted and with some bitterness, too. Full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation in palate. Excellent complementary addition to smoked sausage or salami, but would be very careful when combining it with smoked bananas...
Very (almost radically) aromatic beer, smoked ham at the very moment of the opening, rich bitter chocolate taste afterwards. A must-try for the porter fans.

Bottled 330ml. -from Za Popent Pivoteka, Ljubljana. Deep black coloured, small to medium sized beige head, mild smoked ham in the nose. The taste is light smoked ham, chocolate with mild roasty notes. Also some notes of meat. Really enjoyable brew.
